1.text: “Call out if you please, but who will answer? To which of the holy ones will you turn?

2.text: For resentment kills a fool, and envy slays the simple.

3.text: I have seen a fool taking root, but suddenly his house was cursed.

4.text: His sons are far from safety, crushed in court without a defender.

5.text: The hungry consume his harvest, taking it even from the thorns, and the thirsty pant after his wealth.

6.text: For distress does not spring from the dust, and trouble does not sprout from the ground.

7.text: Yet man is born to trouble as surely as sparks fly upward.

8.text: However, if I were you, I would appeal to God and lay my cause before Him—

9.text: the One who does great and unsearchable things, wonders without number.

10.text: He gives rain to the earth and sends water upon the fields.

11.text: He sets the lowly on high, so that mourners are lifted to safety.

12.text: He thwarts the schemes of the crafty, so that their hands find no success.

13.text: He catches the wise in their craftiness, and sweeps away the plans of the cunning.

14.text: They encounter darkness by day and grope at noon as in the night.

15.text: He saves the needy from the sword in their mouth and from the clutches of the powerful.

16.text: So the poor have hope, and injustice shuts its mouth.

17.text: Blessed indeed is the man whom God corrects; so do not despise the discipline of the Almighty.

18.text: For He wounds, but He also binds; He strikes, but His hands also heal.

19.text: He will rescue you from six calamities; no harm will touch you in seven.

20.text: In famine He will redeem you from death, and in battle from the stroke of the sword.

21.text: You will be hidden from the scourge of the tongue, and will not fear havoc when it comes.

22.text: You will laugh at destruction and famine, and need not fear the beasts of the earth.

23.text: For you will have a covenant with the stones of the field, and the wild animals will be at peace with you.

24.text: You will know that your tent is secure, and find nothing amiss when inspecting your home.

25.text: You will know that your offspring will be many, your descendants like the grass of the earth.

26.text: You will come to the grave in full vigor, like a sheaf of grain gathered in season.

27.text: Indeed, we have investigated, and it is true! So hear it and know for yourself.”
